SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class GraphManager

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.GraphManager
public class GraphManager extends Object
Manages the generation and display of graphical representations of benchmarking results in RSA cryptography. This includes histograms, box plots, and line graphs for both individual key analysis and comparative analysis across different key sizes and configurations. The GraphManager supports a 'comparison mode' which allows benchmarking and comparing results between custom parameter In this mode, users can compare the performance of different key sizes and configurations side-by-side using a variety of graph types.

  • Constructor Details

    • GraphManager

      public GraphManager(int totalTrials, int totalKeys, int numRowsComparisonMode, int numKeySizesForComparisonMode, boolean isSignatureOperationResults)
      Initializes a new GraphManager with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      totalTrials - Number of trials conducted in benchmarking.
      totalKeys - Number of keys used in benchmarking.
      numRowsComparisonMode - Number of rows for comparison mode.
      numKeySizesForComparisonMode - Number of key sizes selected for comparison mode.
      isSignatureOperationResults - Flag indicating if results are from a signature operation.

  • Method Details

    • calculateFreedmanDiaconisBinWidth

      public static double calculateFreedmanDiaconisBinWidth(List<Long> results)
      Calculates the bin width using the Freedman-Diaconis rule.
      Parameters:
      results - The results to use in the calculation.
      Returns:
      The calculated bin width.

    • calculateNumberOfBins

      public static int calculateNumberOfBins(List<Long> results, double freedmanDiaconisBinWidth)
      Calculates the number of bins for a histogram based on the given results.
      Parameters:
      results - The results to use in the calculation.
      freedmanDiaconisBinWidth - The bin width assumed to be calculated using the Freedman-Diaconis rule.
      Returns:
      The number of bins.

    • createStackedHistogramDatasetSignatures

      public org.jfree.data.category.CategoryDataset createStackedHistogramDatasetSignatures(int keySizeIndex, int numKeySizesForComparisonMode, List<ResultsModel> resultsModels)
      Creates a dataset for a stacked histogram specifically tailored to signature operations. This dataset is generated based on the key size index provided and is intended for comparative analysis in 'comparison mode'.
      Parameters:
      keySizeIndex - The index of the key size for which the dataset is prepared.
      numKeySizesForComparisonMode - Number of key sizes selected for comparison mode.
      resultsModels - A list of ResultsModel objects containing benchmarking data.
      Returns:
      A CategoryDataset suitable for creating a stacked histogram, reflecting the distribution of results for different hash functions and key configurations.

    • createStackedHistogramDataset

      public org.jfree.data.category.CategoryDataset createStackedHistogramDataset(int keyIndex, List<String> comparisonModeRowHeaders, List<Long> results, List<ResultsModel> resultsModels)
      Creates a dataset for a general stacked histogram based on a given key index. This dataset is used for generating histograms in comparison modes, providing a detailed view of the benchmarking results.
      Parameters:
      keyIndex - The index of the key for which the dataset is prepared.
      comparisonModeRowHeaders - Headers for rows in comparison mode.
      results - A list of benchmarking results.
      resultsModels - A list of ResultsModel objects containing benchmarking data.
      Returns:
      A CategoryDataset suitable for creating a stacked histogram.

    • displayStackedHistogram

      public org.jfree.chart.fx.ChartViewer displayStackedHistogram(int keyIndex, int keyLength, List<ResultsModel> resultsModels, List<String> comparisonModeRowHeaders, List<Long> results)
      Displays a histogram for a specific key size in comparison mode. This method generates a histogram chart containing results for multiple keys, facilitating comparative analysis.
      Parameters:
      keyIndex - Index of the key size for which the histogram is displayed.
      keyLength - The length of the cryptographic key.
      resultsModels - A list of ResultsModel objects containing benchmarking data.
      comparisonModeRowHeaders - Headers for the rows in comparison mode.
      results - A list of long values representing benchmarking results.
      Returns:
      A ChartViewer containing the stacked histogram.

    • displayHistogramForKey

      public org.jfree.chart.fx.ChartViewer displayHistogramForKey(int keyIndex, int keyLength, List<ResultsModel> resultsModels)
      Creates and displays a histogram for a specific key.
      Parameters:
      keyIndex - Index of the key for which the histogram is displayed.
      keyLength - Length of the key for which the histogram is generated.
      resultsModels - A list of ResultsModel objects containing benchmarking data.
      Returns:
      A ChartViewer containing the histogram.

    • setKeyIndex

      public void setKeyIndex(int keyIndex)
      Sets the current key index being displayed in the results view.
      Parameters:
      keyIndex - The index of the key to be set as the current key.

    • displayLastSelectGraphForNewKeySize

      public void displayLastSelectGraphForNewKeySize()
      Displays the last selected graph type for the newly selected key size. This method triggers the display of the most recently viewed graph type, ensuring continuity in graph viewing when the key size changes.

    • setupCommonGraphObservers

      public void setupCommonGraphObservers(ResultsView resultsView)
      Sets up observers for graph buttons common to both comparison and non-comparison mode. This method adds event handlers to the histogram and box plot buttons in the results view, enabling user interaction for graph switching.
      Parameters:
      resultsView - The results view that contains the graph buttons.

    • setupComparisonModeGraphObservers

      public void setupComparisonModeGraphObservers(ResultsView resultsView)
      Sets up observers specifically for the graph buttons in comparison mode. This method extends the common graph observers setup by adding an observer for the line graph button, allowing users to switch to the line graph view in comparison mode.
      Parameters:
      resultsView - The results view that contains the graph buttons.

    • setLastSelectedGraphButton

      public void setLastSelectedGraphButton(javafx.scene.control.Button lastSelectedGraphButton)
      Sets the reference to the last selected graph button. This method is used to store the currently active graph button in the GraphManager. It allows the application to remember the user's last graph choice and maintain the active state of the corresponding button across different result sets and key sizes.
      Parameters:
      lastSelectedGraphButton - The button that was last selected by the user.
